pageContent: Purpose: Positron Emission Tomography is an important molecular imaging technique for detection and diagnoses of various disease states. This work aims to develop novel titanium-45 (t½ = 3.08 h) PET tracers using Prostate Specific Membrane Antigen (PSMA) targeting vectors for imaging of prostate cancer as proof of concept for this relatively unexplored isotope.

metaData.source:
Influence of transurethral resection on sexual dysfunction in patients with prostate cancer
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/8944510/
